intro: Crepis sprengeriana, commonly known as the Sprenger's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Crepis sprengeriana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
